page.title: 06FARMING 1
page.content: THE FARMS AROUND BARRY ARE COTSIDE,GRANGE OF BARRY,RAVENSBY, ,WOODHILL AND PITSKELLY. ALL ARE MENTIONED IN PARISH RECORDS DATING BACK SEVERAL HUNDRED YEARS.THE FARMS ARE ALL MIXED FARMS,GROWING CEREAL CROPS,POTATOES AND THEY HAVE CATTLE. NO FARM HAS A DAIRY HERD NOWADAYS.THE GREATEST CHANGE IN THE LAST 50 YEARS IS THE AMOUNT OF MACHINERY NOW BEING USED ON FARMS AND THESE HAVE REPLACED MAN POWER,SO THAT FARMS NOW EMPLOY FEWER MEN TO DO THE WORK.POTATOES ARE A POPULAR CROP IN THIS AREA ,WHILE SOME FARMS HAVE INTRODUCED FRUIT CROPS SUCH AS RASPBERRIES AND STRAWBERRIES. GRANGE OF BARRY FARM DATES BACK TO THE 11TH CENTURY WHEN THE MONKS FROM BALMERINO OWNED THE LANDS.IN THE 15TH CENTURY THE WELL WOODED LANDS WERE USED AS HUNTING GROUNDS BY THE KINGS OF SCOTLAND.
